items.content_html: Fixes other instances in Web/API of the problem identified in #8795.
items.title: Fix strong inside em

items.content_html:
Issue number that this PR fixes (if any). For example: 'Fixes #987654321'

None.

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

The distinction between text/xml and application/xml is obsolete as of RFC 7303, and application/xml is recommended. This change also adds a note about the possibility that more specific MIME types may apply to XML files and removes the unnecessary backticks around "XML."

Anything else that could help us review it

Nothing I can think of.
items.title: Update XML's entry in list of common MIME types

items.content_html:
When a reader copy-pastes the whole code with the icon, the reader has to explicitly add the fruittype variable, otherwise a ReferenceError is thrown.
Added the variable to avoid the error.
items.title: Add variable for swtich statement.

items.content_html: This PR removes the documentation for the CryptoKeyPair dictionary from MDN. Correlates with its removal in BCD (see mdn/browser-compat-data#12346).
items.title: Remove CryptoKeyPair from MDN docs

items.content_html:
Issue number that this PR fixes (if any). For example: 'Fixes #987654321'

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

Hi, I updated the description to properly define the examples. "Traditional function" to me usually has a name, so when the documentation used "traditional function" I was a bit confused as it really wasn't and I thought it might also be confusing to most beginners who haven't encountered anonymous functions.

Anything else that could help us review it
items.title: updated description of anonymous function

items.content_html:
What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

The glossary entry "OpenGL" does not have a technical reference to its website opengl.org like other similar entries, e.g. ECMAScript.

This PR adds such a reference, to hopefully help those who seek technical references for OpenGL.
items.title: Add technical reference for opengl.org

items.content_html:
Fixes #8830

(I also removed a mention of ES6, useless nowadays)
items.title: Precise context of toString()

items.content_html:
Issue number that this PR fixes (if any). For example: 'Fixes #987654321'

Fixes #8696

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

The original sentence "To watch for intersection relative to the root element, specify null." does not explain what to specify null for. However, detailed explanation about intersection observer options is available down below, so I additionally put a short notice.

Anything else that could help us review it

@angelayanpan Please review whether the change is sufficient enough to not confuse the future readers.
items.title: Fix: clarify what to set null in intersectionObserver usage paragraph

items.content_html:
This PR is in regard to the Sending and retrieving form data article, section "Other languages and frameworks" https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/Forms/Sending_and_retrieving_form_data#other_languages_and_frameworks

It seems to make sense to include a framework for Java since it's one of the most used languages in the world currently and is often taught in schools.

Spring has a quick-start tutorial specifically about handling form submission which seems like a really good fit.

Let me know if there's anything you'd like changed!

Issue number that this PR fixes (if any). For example: 'Fixes #987654321'

Not an issue, just an improvement.

What was wrong/why is this fix needed? (quick summary only)

My addition includes a server-side framework for Java because it's a very popular language.

Anything else that could help us review it

Nope!
items.title: Add Spring as Java server framework
